intro: Picris hieracioides subsp. sonchoides, commonly known as the hairy leaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are generally hairy and alternate, with a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer months. It is often found in dry, sunny environments and is considered a common weed in agricultural areas.
